This alabaster shows Christ being lowered into the tomb, the lower part of his body in a shroud, with a twisted cord or torse round his head representing the crown of thorns. To the right Joseph of Arimathea is holding Christ's body. He wears a mitre-shaped hat (top missing), with a purse hanging from his belt. Nicodemus, wearing a crown-shaped hat, holds Christ's head and shoulder
column2: according to John 19: 39-40 he brought myrrh and aloes and they wound the body in linen cloths with the spices. An ordinary medieval tomb is shown, not the cave described in the Gospels.

column1: In the centre of the composition, a halo behind her head, stands the Virgin Mary with hands clasped in grief. Behind her Mary Cleophas and Mary Salome, bare-headed
column2: all three women have their cloaks fastened with identical broaches. The damaged figure at top right may be identified by the palm he is holding as St John the Evangelist. The top edge of the alabaster is formed by the cross beam of Christ's cross.

column1: Kneeling in front of the tomb and wiping the ointment from Christ's hand with her long hair is Mary Magdalene, whose emblem, the alabaster vessel of precious ointment, stands prominently at the front centre of the composition.
A popular subject and a standard scene in Passion of Christ altarpieces, one hundred surviving entombment panels are recorded.
